alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central San Miguel and south central Montrose Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norwood, or 36 miles southwest of Montrose, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central San Miguel and south central Montrose Counties, including the following locations... Redvale. This includes the following highways... Colorado 141 between mile markers 48 and 56. Colorado 145 between mile markers 99 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
